rok commented on pull request #5200: ARROW-1456: [Python] Run s3fs unit tests in Travis CI
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5200
 
 
   This is to enable Python S3 tests in CI with minio as requested in [ARROW-1456](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1456) and [ARROW-4208](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4208).

rok commented on issue #5200: [WIP] ARROW-1456: [Python] Run s3fs unit tests in Travis CI
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5200#issuecomment-527549389
 
 
   @kszucs, I'd like to add [minio](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/f7f2805e2cdb593223d542ac228b3fd624acaffe/ci/docker_install_conda.sh#L44) binary and python `s3fs` package to the docker image. This would be to enable S3 CI tests. Do I need to do something besides this PR?

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: We'll need to set up an S3 bucket to write to with credentials that cannot compromise anyone's AWS account. I've been testing locally with a user that I set up but I wouldn't be comfortable checking in these credentials, even in encrypted form, without more scrutiny
fields.summary: [Python] Run s3fs unit tests in Travis CI

comments.body: Mocking s3 may already be enough for the arrow unit tests. E.g. https://github.com/spulec/moto
Alternatively we could setup a small S3 server in Docker using https://github.com/minio/minio
